perturbation.original_text: Sponsor shall pay $*** to SDBF pursuant to the following:                     $ *** due on or before April 30, 2008     $ *** due on or before June 30, 2008     $ *** due on or before August 31, 2008
perturbation.changed_text: Sponsor shall pay $*** to SDBF pursuant to the following:                     $ *** due on or before April 30, 2008     $ *** due on or before June 30, 2008     $ *** due on or before August 31, 2008. Sponsor may also remit the entire amount in one lump sum payment at their convenience.
perturbation.explanation: The original text outlines a strict payment schedule, but the modified text introduces an optional lump sum payment at the Sponsor's convenience, creating a conflict. It is now unclear whether the Sponsor is obligated to adhere to the original installment schedule or can opt for a single payment.

perturbation.original_text: SDBF agrees to indemnify, protect, defend, and hold harmless Sponsor,  its affiliates, predecessors and successors, owners, agents, partners, officials, employees and representatives (collectively, the "Sponsor Parties") from and against any and all actions, demands, liabilities, losses, claims, damages, costs or expenses, including without limitation court costs and attorneys' fees (collectively, the "Claims"), arising from the negligence or willful misconduct of SDBF or any of its affiliates, predecessors and successors, owners, agents, partners, officials, employees or representatives.
perturbation.changed_text: SDBF agrees to indemnify, protect, defend, and hold harmless Sponsor,  its affiliates, predecessors and successors, owners, agents, partners, officials, employees and representatives (collectively, the "Sponsor Parties") from and against any and all actions, demands, liabilities, losses, claims, damages, costs or expenses, including without limitation court costs but excluding attorneys' fees (collectively, the "Claims"), arising from the gross negligence of SDBF or any of its affiliates, predecessors and successors, owners, agents, partners, officials, employees or representatives.
perturbation.explanation: The original text includes attorney fees in the indemnification, covering negligence or misconduct whereas the modified text removes them and only covers gross negligence. This creates contradiction regarding who pays legal cost in case of negligence but not gross negligence.

perturbation.original_text: Any notice required to be given hereunder shall be in lieu  of, and not in addition to, any notice required under California Code of Civil Procedure Section 1161 or any similar or successor law.
perturbation.changed_text: Any notice required to be given hereunder shall be in lieu  of, and in addition to, any notice required under California Code of Civil Procedure Section 1161 or any similar or successor law.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated the contract's notice provisions are *instead of* legal requirements. This change now states they are *in addition to* legal requirements. This could cause confusion on what is required for legal notices.
